Name: Manager Event Message Registry
Description: This registry defines messages to be used by a service to indicate conditions or configuration changes related to a manager.  The affected manager may provide the Redfish service.

ManagerReset.Description: Indicates that a manager reset occurred.
ManagerReset.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a manager reset occurred.
ManagerReset.Message: Manager `%1` performed a '%2' type of reset.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the manager that was reset.
The type of reset that occurred.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies the affected manager.
This argument shall contain the type of reset that occurred.  This argument shall contain one of the values of the `ResetType` enumeration from the `Resource` schema.

ManagerResetWatchdogTimer.Description: Indicates that a manager reset occurred due to a watchdog timer action.
ManagerResetWatchdogTimer.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a manager reset occurred due to a watchdog timer action.
ManagerResetWatchdogTimer.Message: Manager `%1` performed a '%2' type of reset due to watchdog timer action.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the manager that was reset.
The type of reset that occurred.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies the affected manager.
This argument shall contain the type of reset that occurred.  This argument shall contain one of the values of the `ResetType` enumeration from the `Resource` schema.
ManagerResetWatchdogTimer.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

ManagerSwitchedToBackupSoftwareImage.Description: Indicates that a manager switched to a backup software image.
ManagerSwitchedToBackupSoftwareImage.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a manager is using a backup software image.
ManagerSwitchedToBackupSoftwareImage.Message: Manager `%1` switched to a backup software image.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the manager.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies the affected manager.
ManagerSwitchedToBackupSoftwareImage.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.
